info.name: PhysioPrompt API
info.description: Complete API collection for PhysioPrompt Laravel application. Updated with unified JSON-based assessment structure. All 22 sections (12 Subjective + 10 Objective) now use unified endpoints with JSON storage. Subjective: PUT /api/physio/assessments/subjective/section. Objective: PUT /api/physio/assessments/objective/section. Objective sections require Subjective to be 100% complete first.

request.description: Get public application settings and statistics for home page. No authentication required.
User/Doctor login endpoint. Returns user data with role and subscription information, along with authentication token. Use this token in Authorization header for protected routes.
Request password reset link. Sends a password reset token to the user's email. In development, the reset link is returned in the response. In production, the link will be sent via email only.
Reset user password using the token received via email. The token is valid for 24 hours. After successful reset, the user can login with the new password.
Get paginated list of all assessments for the authenticated user. Returns assessments with their subjective and objective process data.
Check if user has any completed assessments. Returns boolean flags for subjective, objective, and overall completion status.
Quick check if user has any draft or in-progress assessments. Returns has_drafts (boolean) and count (number).
Get all draft and in-progress assessments with completion percentages. Returns list of assessments with subjective_percentage, objective_percentage, and overall_progress.
Get all assessments grouped by status (drafts and completed). Returns separate arrays for drafts and completed assessments with completion percentages and dates.

Create a new assessment or return existing draft/in-progress assessment. If force_new is false (default), returns existing draft if found. If force_new is true, creates a new assessment even if drafts exist. Creates both Subjective and Objective assessment processes automatically.

Get a specific assessment by ID. Only returns assessments that belong to the authenticated user.

**Note:** Returns 404 Not Found if:
- Assessment ID doesn't exist in the database
- Assessment exists but doesn't belong to the authenticated user

**Response includes:** All assessment data including JSON columns for subjective and objective sections.
Update assessment status. Status can be: draft, in_progress, or completed. Note: clinical_impression and rehab_program are now stored in assessments_process table, not assessments table.
Mark assessment as completed. Only works when both Subjective and Objective processes are 100% complete. Increments assessment usage count.
Delete an assessment. This will cascade delete related assessment processes and all section data.

item.name: Subjective Assessment
item.description: Unified endpoint for all 12 Subjective Assessment sections. Use the same endpoint with different section_name values. Data is stored as JSON in the assessments table.

request.description:
Unified endpoint to update any Subjective Assessment section. 

**section_name values:**
- `basic_details` - Basic Patient Details (Section 1)
- `chief_complaint` - Chief Complaint (Section 2)
- `pain_characteristics` - Pain Characteristics (Section 3)
- `history_present` - History of Present Condition (Section 4)
- `functional_limitations` - Functional Limitations (Section 5)
- `red_flags` - Red Flag Screening (Section 6)
- `yellow_flags` - Yellow Flags (Section 7)
- `medical_history` - Medical History (Section 8)
- `lifestyle` - Lifestyle & Social History (Section 9)
- `ice` - ICE Assessment (Section 10)
- `region_specific` - Region Specific (Section 11)
- `outcome_measures` - Outcome Measures (Section 12)

**Note:** When saving `basic_details`, patient_name, patient_age, patient_gender, and patient_occupation are automatically extracted and stored in separate columns for easy admin listing.

Unified endpoint to update any Objective Assessment section. 

**section_name values:**
- `observation_general` - Observations & General Examination (Section 1)
- `palpation` - Palpation (Section 2)
- `range_of_motion` - Range of Motion (Section 3)
- `muscle_strength` - Muscle Strength (Section 4)
- `neurological_exam` - Neurological Examination (Section 5)
- `special_tests` - Special Tests (Section 6)
- `functional_assessment` - Functional Assessment (Section 7)
- `joint_mobility` - Joint Mobility (Section 8)
- `outcome_measures` - Outcome Measures (Section 9)
- `red_flags` - Red Flags (Section 10)

**IMPORTANT:** Subjective assessment must be 100% complete before Objective sections can be accessed. Returns 403 error if Subjective is not complete.
Get dashboard statistics including counts of admins, users, plans, and subscriptions
Change password for the authenticated admin. Requires old password, new password, and password confirmation.
Get application settings (logo, app_name, app_details)
Update application settings. app_name is required, logo and app_details are optional.
Get all statistics (patients, clinics, countries, years) with icon, title, and count
Bulk update statistics. Each statistic requires id, title, and count. icon and sort_order are optional.
Update a single statistic by ID. title and count are required, icon and sort_order are optional.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Pro Plan",
  "slug": "pro",
  "price": 1999.0,
  "original_price": 2499.0,
  "discounted_price": 1999.0,
  "description": "Professional plan with all features",
  "features": ["Unlimited assessments", "All features", "Priority support"],
  "free_assessments_limit": 0,
  "unlimited_assessments": true,
  "ad_free": true,
  "pdf_download": true,
  "ai_impression": true,
  "ai_rehab_program": true,
  "reassessment_enabled": true,
  "is_active": true
}
